clay.input

Class SimpleInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • clay.input.SimpleInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CSVInput, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileInput, StringInput

    public abstract class SimpleInput
extends Object
implements CSVInput
    Represents a simple CSV input backed up by a plain String which this class will parse into a 2D list of strings.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected List<List<String>> data
      The input string parsed into a 2D list of strings.
      protected String delimiter
      The delimiter that separate the CSV data cells.
      protected String escapeQuotation
      The substring that denotes the escape of a quotation of a CSV cell.
      protected LinkedHashMap<Class<? extends Filter>,Filter> filters
      A map holding filters that will be applied (in order!) to all the data cells from the CSV input string.
      protected String input
      The actual CSV input string.
      protected String quotation
      The substring that denotes the quotation of a CSV cell.
      protected String recordEnd
      The substring that denotes the end of a CSV record.

      • Fields inherited from interface clay.input.CSVInput

        DEFAULT_DELIMITER, DEFAULT_ESCAPE_QUOTATION, DEFAULT_QUOTATION, DEFAULT_RECORD_END

      Inserts a row of values iff the row contains at least one cell that is non-null and not empty.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleInput

        public SimpleInput(String input,
                   String delimiter,
                   String quotation,
                   String escapeQuotation,
                   String recordEnd)
            throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new instance of a SimpleInput.
        Parameters:
        input - the actual CSV input string.
        delimiter - the delimiter that separate the CSV data cells.
        quotation - the substring that denotes the quotation of a CSV cell.
        escapeQuotation - the substring that denotes the escape of a quotation of a CSV cell.
        recordEnd - the substring that denotes the end of a CSV record.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when any of the parameters is null.

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public CSVInput with(Filter filter)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     IllegalStateException
        Adds a filter which will be applied to all CSV cells when parsing the input.
        Specified by:
        with in interface CSVInput
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to add.
        Returns:
        this instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the filter is null.
        IllegalStateException - when the input is already parsed, which is done when CSVInput.getRecords() is first called.

      • without

        public CSVInput without(Class<? extends Filter> filterType)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                        IllegalStateException
        Removes a filter which will not be applied to all CSV cells when parsing the input.
        Specified by:
        without in interface CSVInput
        Parameters:
        filterType - the filter type to remove.
        Returns:
        this instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the filter is null.
        IllegalStateException - when the input is already parsed, which is done when CSVInput.getRecords() is first called.

      • ahead

        protected boolean ahead(String substring,
                        int index)
        Returns true iff the substring at the given index can be seen from the input.
        Parameters:
        substring - the sub string to check.
        index - the index from the input to start looking ahead from.
        Returns:
        true iff the substring at the given index can be seen from the input.

      • insert

        protected void insert(int rowIndex,
                      int column,
                      String value,
                      List<String> dataRow)
        Inserts a cell value if none of the applied filters return null.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - the index of the row of the cell.
        column - the index of the column of the cell.
        value - the value of the cell.
        dataRow - the list holding all of the values in the current row.

      • insert

        protected void insert(List<String> dataRow)
        Inserts a row of values iff the row contains at least one cell that is non-null and not empty.
        Parameters:
        dataRow - the row to add.
